result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane M. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shane M. Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shane M. Miller was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shane M. Miller in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Defendant Shane M. Miller in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 104 and 14 CF 105.  9:25 AM Atty Jarvis addressed the Court.  Court makes stmt.  State addressed the Court defendant plead to 4 felonies.  Atty Jarvis agrees.  Atty Jarvis makes stmt.  Atty Frost makes arguement 365 days in custody as a condition of probation.  Atty Jarvis makes arguement would like to see him participate in drug court.  Defendant addressed the Court.  Court addressed the defendant.  Defendant continues.  

Court: 13 CF 96  1 yr county jail credit 190 days time served with good time and huber for work and treatment - costs - dna surcharge

14 CF 104 - sentence w/held probation 5 years  concurrent with 13 CF 96- costs - any and all assessments that may be recommend and complete any and all counseling that may be recommended - when jail is completed in 13 CF 96 go directly to compassion house - DNA surcharge - no drugs - 100 community service each year on probation

14 CF 105 - sentence w/held probation 3 years concurrent to 14 CF 104 and 13 CF 96 - costs - DNA surcharge - all assessments - complete any counseling that may be recommended - no drugs

 poss. meth count 3 - sentence w/held probation 3 years concurrent to other probation and 13 CF 96- costs - DNA surcharge - all assessments that may be recommended and complete any counseling that may be recommended - no drugs
PSI can be found in 13 CF 96
Sentencing hearing on January 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Shane M. Miller in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Defendant Shane M. Miller in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Jarvis recites plea agreement.  Also has 14 CF 104 and 14 CF 105.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Atty Jarvis w/draws motions.  Defendant entered plea of G.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 13 CF 96 - count 1 14 CF 104 and count 2 in 14 CF 105 and count 5 in 14 CF 105 - other counts dismissed - PSI - no agent - no agreement between parties they will be free to argue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant, Shane M. Miller appeared with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Attorney Angeline E. Winton appeared for the State. Ms. Winton asks the court to take notice of certified bail bond from 13 CF 96 in this case.  
Atty Winton calls Det. Tyler Walsh to the stand.  Mr. Walsh sworn in by Deputy Clerk, takes stand and is questioned by Atty Winton.  Atty Jarvis stipulates to Mr. Walsh's qualifications. 
Court - let the record reflect that officer identified defendant. 
Cross by Atty Jarvis
No - redirect Mr. Walsh excused and steps down.
Argument Atty Winton -asks for bind over - probable cause
Atty Jarvis - no argument
Court - find based on testimony provided and binds over for trial
Atty Jarvis advises court that his client wishes to move forward this date and enters pleas of NG

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Shane M. Miller in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Defendant Shane M. Miller in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 105.  Atty Jarvis waived reading and time limits for prelim on both cases requests the court recuse on these cases Judge Bitney has been assigned to one of the cases already.  Court will recuse.  Bail will continue  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed Doctor.  Curfew 8 PM to 6 AM daily must be at W6095 Cranberry Dr. Shell Lake
